title: theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: ‘I’m desperately trying to do right by everyone’: I’m giving my son $250K and my daughter 50% of a property. Is that fair?
items.description: “My son had no financial input into that property.”

items.title: ‘I am increasingly resentful’: My husband of 10 years has $1 million and cars worth $200K. Why won’t he give me money?
items.description: “I maintain the household, walk the dogs and cook regular meals for us both.”

items.title: ‘She’ll let him live there for free’: My sister wants to buy our impoverished brother’s house. Is that a bad idea?
items.description: “Her only concern is that it will show up as an asset or rental property on her end.”

items.title: Trump’s $1 million ‘gold card’ immigration program is close to launching. Here’s what’s ahead.
items.description: “This program is not going to be as easy as the administration initially claimed,” says one expert in immigration law.

items.title: ‘I love my work’: I’m a 61-year-old Chicago public-school teacher with a $60K annual pension. Is it safe?
items.description: “I am aware that my pension as a Chicago public school teacher is dependent on factors that are very much in flux right now.”
